title: 113_hr1069
content: The Act titled "TANF Substance Abuse Prevention Act" requires drug screening and testing for applicants and recipients of assistance under State TANF programs. The TANF Substance Abuse Prevention Act mandates drug screening and testing for applicants and recipients of State TANF assistance programs to identify illegal drug use and high-risk substance abuse. The TANF Substance Abuse Prevention Act requires drug screening and testing for applicants and recipients of State TANF assistance programs to identify illegal drug use and high-risk substance abuse. The program may include continued testing at random intervals after the initial screening. The TANF Substance Abuse Prevention Act mandates drug screening and testing for individuals receiving State TANF assistance to identify illegal drug use and high-risk substance abuse. Grants under section 403 cannot be used to assist individuals not screened or tested for illegal drug use. The TANF Substance Abuse Prevention Act requires drug screening and testing for individuals receiving State TANF assistance to identify illegal drug use. A State may not provide assistance to an individual unless they are screened for drug use after the 3rd month of receiving assistance. The TANF Substance Abuse Prevention Act mandates drug screening and testing for State TANF recipients at high risk of substance abuse to detect illegal drug use. The Secretary cannot waive these provisions, and illegal drugs are defined as controlled substances under the Controlled Substances Act. If an individual is denied assistance, the State must still provide aid to other family members. The TANF Substance Abuse Prevention Act requires drug screening for high-risk State TANF recipients to detect illegal drug use. If an individual is denied assistance, the State must still provide aid to other family members through protective or vendor payments to a 3rd party. The effective date for these amendments is one year after the enactment of the Act, with a possible delay if state legislation is required. The State plan under the TANF Substance Abuse Prevention Act must comply with additional requirements imposed by the amendments. Failure to meet these requirements before the specified deadline will not result in non-compliance with section 402(a). Each year of a 2-year legislative session is considered a separate regular session of the State legislature.
